intro: Chorizanthe valida, commonly known as the desert holly, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spiny, leaf-like structures that are actually modified leaves called phyllodes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to arid environments, with deep roots that help it survive in dry conditions. Chorizanthe valida is often found in sandy or gravelly soils along dry streambeds and open plains.
